fields.title: Hi 你好
fields.subtitle: I’m Jedy
fields.introduction:
I am a creative technologist with an academic background in electronic engineering and digital art. While working and living in New York, Tokyo, Singapore and Shanghai, I have been developing brand experiences, data visualizations, generative design, and interactive experiences for Nike, Samsung, Verizon, Shiseido, Google, Kao and more.

My works have received awards from One Club ADC Awards, the Creative Review, the One Show, and have exhibited in Shanghai International Science & Art Exhibition (Shanghai), Maker Faire (New York), iLight Festival (Singapore), China International Import Expo (Shanghai) and Awakening Bangkok (Bangkok).

fields.title: Innovation
fields.description: A system using 5 sensors to achieve position detection in a space

content.value: On the web version, I utilized P5.js and Tone.js libraries for music playback. For this physical version, I opted for Processing and Beats (a MIDI control software) to dynamically adjust the pace and pitch of the music on the fly.

fields.title: mood - As for the music, we collaborated with a digital music composer

content.value: As for the music, we collaborated with a digital music composer to create 16 tracks, encompassing bass, beats, drums, and main melodies in 4 distinct styles. These tracks can seamlessly blend with each other while maintaining musical harmony.

fields.title: mood - Audiences at these exhibitions expressed significant

content.value: Audiences at these exhibitions expressed significant interest and provided positive feedback. Some even remarked that this music player revolutionizes the music player industry by serving as a more profound bridge between the audience and music, fostering greater human connection compared to other devices.

fields.title: mood - The 'm o o d' music player was initially showcased

content.value: The 'm o o d' music player was initially showcased at the ITP Sprint Show 2015 hosted by NYU ITP. Subsequently, it was selected for exhibition at major interactive media events, such as the New York Maker Faire 2015 and the NYC Arcade 2015.

fields.title: mood - I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors

content.value: I am utilizing Moteino R4 with RFM69W 915MHz as my RF sensors. I have embedded an RF emitter inside the music player and placed one RF receiver at each corner of the table. By analyzing the signal strength received by each RF receiver (with certain noise filtering), I am able to calculate the relative position of the music player on the table.

fields.title: mood - Instead of using light-sensing technology

content.value: Instead of using light-sensing technology like in an optical mouse, which would not allow users to lift the music player above the table, I opted for Radio Frequency (RF) Sensors after conducting research. At the core of this technology is an RF emitter that continuously emits radio waves. These waves travel through space and their signal strength changes with distance. A corresponding RF receiver captures these altered waves and determines the distance to the emitter.

fields.title: mood - The biggest challenge of the development

content.value: The biggest challenge of the development is detecting the movement and position of the music player relative to the table.

fields.title: Development
fields.description: 3D Printing + Hardware Prototyping + MIDI Control System + Customized Music Tracks

fields.title: mood - LED loop
fields.description: LED lights illuminating in a sequential loop

content.value: Regarding the exterior design, we utilized 3D printing to create the case of the music player. The case features a ring of white LED lights mounted on its middle layer. The microcontroller inside the case controls the LED lights to illuminate in a sequential loop.

fields.title: mood - We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape

content.value: We designed the music player to be a cylindrical shape in white color, positioned on top of a square table that functions as the square playground in the prototype. Each corner of the table represents a unique style, and the distance between the music player and the corner determines the extent to which that style influences the final music. Users can stand in front of the table, move the music player on the table, and hear the blended music emanating from the table.

fields.title: mood - Web Prototype
fields.caption:
Instructions:
1. Click on full-screen.
2. Click on the play button to start the music.
3. Drag the knob to adjust the mood of the music.
4. Click on the knob to switch between music tracks

fields.title: mood - After receiving positive feedback in user tests of the prototype

content.value: After receiving positive feedback in user tests of the prototype, we proceeded to transform the web demo into a physical product.

fields.title: Prototyping
fields.description: A rapid prototype in web version was developed to test the usability.

fields.title: mood - We proceeded to use p5.js to create a rapid prototype in web version

content.value: We proceeded to use p5.js to create a rapid prototype in web version. The prototype features a square playground where users can move the circular knob around to change the pace, tone, pitch, and explore different combinations of music tracks, resulting in music of various moods.

fields.title: mood - Starting from a class in ITP

content.value: Starting from a class in ITP called interactive music, we had an idea of creating an adaptive music player that allows users to intuitively find music best suited to their current mood.

fields.title: m o o d
fields.subtitle: Interactive Music Player
fields.description: 'm o o d' is an interactive music player product that offers simple and intuitive music control through a tactile user interface, as opposed to a screen-based touch UX design. I collaborated with a designer and a musician to create this innovative product prototype. It has been featured in multiple exhibitions, including New York Maker Faire and The NYC Arcade.

content.value: Block Party traveled to Bangkok, Thailand in December 2023, and was exhibited in Bangkok’s largest light and digital arts festival: Awakening Bangkok.

fields.title: Awakening Bangkok is the annual light and digital art festival of Bangkok.

content.value: Awakening Bangkok is the annual light and digital art festival of Bangkok. It makes a comeback for its sixth edition in 2023. The festival is set to illuminate Phra Nakhon and Pak Khlong Talat with 29 installations and digital art showcases themed “Time Passage” to spotlight the significance of old streets and canals in the Old Town.

fields.title: Glow Shenzhen
fields.description: 深圳光影艺术季, Dec 2023 - Feb 2024

fields.title: Glow Shenzhen 2023, a grand light festival, is one of the most important Light Festival in China.

content.value: Glow Shenzhen 2023, a grand light festival, is one of the most important Light Festival in China.

The light festival, which will run through Feb. 25 next year, features 215 works and installations of light art from various countries. It has its main venue set up in Futian District, with five subvenues in Luohu, Nanshan, Bao'an, Longgang, and Guangming districts, and four exhibition sites in Yantian, Longhua, Pingshan, and Dapeng. A total of 33 themed art events will be held during the festival.

fields.title: Block Party received great attention in Singapore.

content.value: Block Party received great attention in Singapore. Even
Singapore's Prime Minister Lee Hsien Loong visited Block Party and posted it on his personal Facebook account.

fields.title: The dynamic relationship between humans an

content.value: The dynamic relationship between humans and the environment is explored in Block Party, where visitors can participate in collaborative placemaking through the playful medium of dance.

Familiar public housing blocks in Singapore come to life as they react to movement prompts from visitors, taking on personalities of their own. As one bends and twists with the buildings, gardens bloom spontaneously over their facades.

This interactive feature is a reminder of the power we wield to shape our surroundings and make a difference to the world. Through light-hearted interactions, participants are called upon to take responsibility for the environment and a sustainable future.

fields.title: i Light Singapore is Asia’s leading sustainable light

content.value: i Light Singapore is Asia’s leading sustainable light festival held in Marina Bay. First held in 2010, i Light Singapore showcases light art installations created by Singaporean and international artists. These artworks are designed with energy-saving lightings and/or environmentally-friendly materials to encourage festival goers and the general public to adopt sustainable habits in their everyday lives. The Festival also features a diverse range of fringe activities for visitors to enjoy, bringing vibrancy to public spaces in our city centre.
The installation was first shown in i Light Singapore in June 2023.

fields.title: Team
fields.description: A team of 3 people, created the installation in 3 months

fields.title: Block Party
fields.subtitle: Plug & Play
fields.description: Block Party is an immersive and interactive experience that explores the powerful relationship between humans and our environment. Through the playful and accessible medium of dance, visitors can participate in collaborative placemaking and engage with iconic buildings like never before. The installation has shown in multiple festivals and exhibitions in Singapore, Thailand, and China.

fields.title: Plug&Play is a multidisciplinary collective of designers,

content.value: Plug & Play is a multidisciplinary collective of designers, technologists, makers, and engineers who have worked with some of the world’s most innovative brands over the past decade. We work across mediums to create immersive experiences that spark joy and move people. We turn complex issues into simple and interactive solutions that help people imagine the possibilities that we can achieve together.

fields.title: Singapore AR Video - Jose Passing By
fields.description: Test demo: AR Kit human segmentation

fields.title: We encountered a challenge where AR Kit'

content.value: We encountered a challenge where AR Kit's human segmentation only worked properly on models outside of the portal without the pencil effect. I found a workaround to move both the user and the cabinet (the economy class or the business class depending on if the user triggers the portal) outside of the portal after the portal transition is done.

fields.title: Singapore AR - Portal Segmentation Issue - Image
Additionally, we activated the human segmentation func

content.value: Additionally, we activated the human segmentation function from AR Kit. This enabled us to properly crop the user's body or parts of their body and accurately place them in the AR scene when using an iPhone with LiDAR technology.

fields.title: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pip

content.value: In Unity, we utilized a Universal Rendering Pipeline and a pencil effect to create a portal effect.

fields.title: At the end, we were able to create a functional demo within a week and the

content.value: At the end, we were able to create a functional demo within a week and the basic AR prototype within three weeks, after many long days and nights of prototyping.

fields.title: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book

content.value: Imagine a customer is using the mobile app to book a seat. By tapping a button, they would be transported to an AR view that displays a highly immersive representation of themselves seated in a business class seat. This would be achieved by segmenting their legs and body and placing them in the virtual scene, making it feel like they are actually sitting in the business class seat. To add a fun twist, we even thought about showcasing an economy seat for comparison, which would give customers a clearer idea of the differences and potentially entice them to upgrade to business class.

fields.title: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new for

content.value: Initially, we were drawn to the potential of new forms of content such as Augmented Reality (AR), Virtual Reality (VR), Mixed Reality (MR), and Extended Reality (XR). We saw an opportunity to integrate AR/VR into Singapore Airlines' customer experience by showing them a preview of what it would be like to sit in a SIA business class seat while booking a ticket.

fields.title: In terms of models, we were fortunate to find high-fidelity S

content.value: In terms of models, we were fortunate to find high-fidelity Singapore Airlines cabin models on Turbosquid that aligned with the airline's branding. This saved us a significant amount of time and effort.

fields.title: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models

content.value: To bring our vision to life, we segmented the models into individual parts and added animations to each component. This allowed us to create a dynamic animation for the cabin seats and environment that would appear seamlessly.

fields.title: Interactive AR Prototype
fields.subtitle: Singapore Airlines
fields.description: In December 2022, my team was tasked with developing an Augmented Reality (AR) experience for Accenture Song's business development project.

fields.title: We also created similar AR demos fo

content.value: We also created similar AR demos for Thai Airways and Malaysia Airlines, which generated similar enthusiasm and interest from their clients. These demonstrations showcased the potential impact that AR could have on their businesses.

fields.title: In January, we presented the AR demo to Singapore Airlines clients and invited them to try the experience for themselves. The clien

content.value: In January, we presented the AR demo to Singapore Airlines clients and invited them to try the experience for themselves. The clients were impressed by the advancements that AR technology has made and showed great interest in how it could benefit their business.

fields.title: In light of these limitations, I determined that web AR

content.value: In light of these limitations, I determined that web AR would not enable us to create the high-fidelity experience we desired. We ultimately chose Unity AR Foundation (Apple AR Kit) as our AR platform due to its superior capabilities.

fields.title: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spa

content.value: After determining the direction for our experience, I conducted research on various AR platforms and techniques, including 8th Wall, Lens Studio, and Spark Studio. I discovered that these web-based AR platforms were limited in their capabilities and only supported content and models with file sizes less than 10 MB. Additionally, their functionality was limited compared to what could be achieved with native apps, lacking crucial features such as body segmentation and post-processing.
